com.anrapps.ultimatelogcat.logcat

Class Logcat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.anrapps.ultimatelogcat.logcat.Logcat

  • public class Logcat
extends java.lang.Object
    Usage: Must create an instance of Logcat via its constructor which requires a Handler. After calling start method a new task will be started. This task will start a proccess using 'logcat' command. Each some time (@see CAT_DELAY) the task will save output lines into a cache and sends the new lines to the provided handler with the message @see CAT_LOGS. Also it will remove some logs if there are too much of them this way it will send empty message with @see CLEAR_LOGS.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logcat

        public Logcat(Handler handler,
              Level level,
              Format format,
              Buffer buffer)
        Default constructor. Used to initialize a Logcat object
        Parameters:
        handler - Handler which will receive log lines
        level - The minimum log level the Logcat will output
        format - The selected format for the logs
        buffer - The selected buffer for the logs

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the task which will receive the logs and will send them via the provided Handler in the constructor. Also be sure to call stop when not needed (e.g.onPause()) It wont do nothing if not running

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the task started when called start() It wont do nothing if not running

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(Level level)
        Sets the minimum log level for the output logs. This will restart the task so the old logs will be filtered as well
        Parameters:
        level - The minimum level

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(Format format)
        Sets the log output format
        Parameters:
        format - The desired format

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer(Buffer buffer)
        Sets the buffer which will be used for reading logs
        Parameters:
        buffer - The desired buffer

      • setSearchFilter

        public void setSearchFilter(java.lang.String searchFilter)
        Sets a search filter for the output logs. This will restart the task so the old logs will be filtered as well
        Parameters:
        searchFilter - Filter which will be used to get logs

      • removeSearchFilter

        public void removeSearchFilter()
        Removes the previously set filter

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Show whether the task is running or not
        Returns:
        true if running, false otherwise
